[Korean] [English]

`comp.lang.c' is the news group discussing the C programming language itself. Steve Summit has maintained the `C Programming FAQs'. You can see his original FAQs in his homepage or the faqs.org. He granted me translating his work in Korean language. My translating work is almost completed. (You know, it is impossible to make a perfect translation of any work ;-)) There are something to do, for example, some design or layout problem. Because these are not contents specific, so I'm sure that you'll have no problem to read this:

Last modified:

  bare bzipped (.bz2) gzipped (.gz)
Postscript (.ps) cfaqs-ko.ps
( K)		 cfaqs-ko.ps.bz2
( K)		 cfaqs-ko.ps.gz
( K)
PDF (.pdf) cfaqs-ko.pdf
( K)		 cfaqs-ko.pdf.bz2
( K)		 cfaqs-ko.pdf.gz
( K)
HTML (.html) Not provided yet, Sorry!

Current Status

Now, I'm working on the second edition of this translation. It seems that it will be finished until Nov. 30 2001. Wish us luck! ;-)

Troubleshooting

  • To extact archives use gzip or bzip2. (I recommend bzip2 because it's archives is smaller that gzip's.)
  • If you don't know how to read postscript(.ps) file, click here to run about Ghostview.
  • If you don't have any PDF(.pdf) reader, use Xpdf or Acrobat Reader.
